title.narrative: Inception phase Building Capacities for Trade Transnistria

description.narrative: Förberedande fas till ett stöd som avser att stärka förtroende och bidra till konfliktlösning på båda sidorna av floden Nistru genom att bygga kapacitet för handel och export med EU länderna.
Preparatory phase: Support to confidence building and conflict resolution across the Nistru river through building advance capacities for trade and export to the EU countries.

The key objective of the Project’s inception phase was to fulfil all necessary preparation work to ensure smooth start and swift implementation of the project activities, including resolution of administrative and staffing issues and elaboration of plans and working documents, including Annual and Multi-Year Work Plans (AWP and MYWP, respectively) and plans of activities. During inception phase it were also organized consultations with key stakeholders on both banks to secure their buy-in and future engagement. This inception phase lead to designing of the main contribution - `UNDP Building Capacities for Trade Transnistria 2019-2022`(ID 12217). The overall objective and expected outcome of thie project is to secure that men and women on both banks of the Nistru River have better livelihoods and living conditions, due to an improved cross-river cooperation to access the opportunities offered by Moldova’s external trade arrangements, contributing to an environment of trust and cooperation across the post-conflict divide.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The main output of the inception phase - finalization of the project document – was successfully reached, the ProDoc being signed on 22 May 2019 by the Sweden Embassy and UNDP, respectively. It is to be mentioned that the Steering Committee meeting was organized subsequently with EU Confidence Building Measures Board, as an opportunity to promote synergies between the two initiatives, both projects sharing common principles.All the documents, relevant factsheets and terms of references were attached to the report. Besides the Financial Report, the Embassy requested the matching of expenses with planned activities to follow easier the rate of spendings per Project Management and Implementation costs, General Management Support and other potential costs.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
